qas.question: What is as important as identifying plague symptoms?
Why are researchers struggling to identify the history of the plague?

answers.text: the lack of reliable statistics from this period

qas.question: How much do estimations of the population during the plague vary?
Where can population estimates be extrapolated from?
During which years was no census taken?

answers.text: between the time of publication of the Domesday Book and the year 1377
between the time of publication of the Domesday Book and the year 1377

qas.question: In what year did the plague begin in England?
In what year was the Domesday Book written?
What is the Domesday Book about?
In what year did the clergy enter England?

context: It is recognised that an epidemiological account of the plague is as important as an identification of symptoms, but researchers are hampered by the lack of reliable statistics from this period. Most work has been done on the spread of the plague in England, and even estimates of overall population at the start vary by over 100% as no census was undertaken between the time of publication of the Domesday Book and the year 1377. Estimates of plague victims are usually extrapolated from figures from the clergy.
